Crimes.Dispute_Type: Administrative dispute involving public service appointment integrity
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Public Service Commission breached procedural fairness and had jurisdiction under section 69 of the PSEA
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Investigation into alleged misrepresentation during a federal public service appointment
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Alleged false references provided by the applicant
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 69 of the Public Service Employment Act
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Misrepresentation through provision of false references
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of notice and opportunity to respond
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to inform applicant of specific allegations and evidence
Crimes.Review_Outcome: Impugned decision set aside; corrective actions declared illegal and invalid
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Applicant denied access to key documents and testimony used against her
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Duty of fairness in administrative investigations
Crimes.Application_Factor: Involvement as a reference provider in appointment process
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Decision set aside, costs awarded to applicant
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Withholding of evidence from the applicant prior to interview
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Doubt cast on authenticity of references provided
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on lack of procedural fairness and jurisdictional overreach
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide notice and disclosure
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose allegations and evidence

Crimes.Crime_Name: Fraud under the Public Service Employment Act

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Commission has jurisdiction to investigate and sanction third parties not directly involved in the appointment process
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Evidence relied upon without providing applicant access

Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate breach of fairness

Crimes.Legal_Rule: Section 69 allows investigation and corrective action for fraud in appointments
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Lack of notice, disclosure, and opportunity to respond
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged participation in fraud as a third-party reference
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim succeeded due to procedural unfairness
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Commission failed to uphold duty of fairness
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: References and statements attributed to the applicant
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Administrative law and public service employment regulations
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Challenged legality and fairness of Commission's process
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities in administrative context
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review, declaration of invalidity, costs
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Quashing of decision, declaration of illegality
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Third party implicated in appointment fraud
